title.narrative: Final draft of a set of guidelines on investigative interviewing and safeguards
An interinstitutional structure is created to lead the initiative Number of meetings organized between the different constituent bodies Number of consultations with the advisory council

target.value: -A final draft of the Guidelines is available -1 meeting of the Steering Committee and 2 meetings of the drafting groups -Stakeholders meeting in October/November in Geneva or New-York -The advisory council has been consulted on the draft of the Guidelines

actual.value: - Draft of the Guidelines continues to be developed: fourth draft being revised - 1 meeting of the Drafting group took place in April in Oslo to move forward with the drafting process. - 1 combined meeting of the Steering Committee and the drafting group took place in Thailand in September to discuss the latest version of the draft and advocacy strategies for endorsement. - A high-level side-event was organised in New York to present the draft Guidelines. - More than 10 members of the Advisory Council were consulted on various aspects of strategy and drafting of the Guidelines.

target.value: The structure is set up. comprised of 3 institutions in the “coordination group”; 15 members in the “steering committee”; 11 members in the “drafting group”; At least 40 members in the “advisory council”. 3 meetings (2 of the Steering Committee and 1 of the drafting group) At least 5 consultation with advisory council members

actual.value:
-A Steering Committee of 15 technical experts from varied disciplines. backgrounds and origins has been created . -A drafting group of 11 experts has been created divided in two groups: investigative interviewing; procedural safeguards . -An Advisory Council of 49 members .
-First meeting of the Steering Committee in Rio to adopt the working plan for 2018-2019 and formally appoint experts to serve on the Drafting Group and Advisory Council in May -First meeting of the Drafting Group to draw up the main lines of the protocol in September in Geneva. -Second meeting of the Steering Committee in December in Tunis to review. compile and revise the first draft of the Guidelines as well as drawing-up revised/additional instructions and guidelines for drafters.
-More than 10 members of the Advisory Council were consulted on various aspects of strategy and drafting of the Guidelines.

Independent Expert on protection against violence and discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity. Special Rapporteur on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities -European Committee for the Prevention of Torture (CPT) -OSCE/ODIHR

target.value: The set of Guidelines is presented in at least seven national. regional or international Forums

actual.value: Regional bodies: - side-event at the African Commission on Human and People’s Rights. which featured the participation of the Committee for the Prevention of Torture in Africa and the League of Arab States (May 2019). - OSCE forum on multilateralism in the fight against torture. before member States of the OSCE. and the inclusion of a recommendation on the Guidelines in the subsequent outcome recommendations (June 2019). OSCE Human Dimension Committee meeting (July) - Mention of the initiative in CPT 2018 annual report - High-level event marking the 30th Anniversary of the Council of Europe’s Committee for the Prevention of Torture (November 2019). UN - High-level event organized on the side-lines of the UN General Assembly’s Third Committee in New York. featuring the participation of the Assistant Secretary General for Human Rights; the chief of UN Police; and H.E. the Ambassador of Denmark in New York.
